001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.jsonrpc;
002
003import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single;
004import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
005import org.bitcoinj.core.Block;
006import org.bitcoinj.base.Sha256Hash;
007import org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.pojo.ChainTip;
008import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.BitcoinClient;
009import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Flowable;
010import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.BitcoinExtendedClient;
011import org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.ChainTipService;
012import org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.zeromq.RxBitcoinZmqService;
013import org.consensusj.bitcoinj.util.BlockUtil;
014
015import javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory;
016import java.net.URI;
017
018/**
019 * A {@link BitcoinClient} enhanced with Reactive features. Can use either ZeroMQ or polling
020 * to implement {@link RxJsonChainTipClient}.
021 * <p>
022 * TODO: answer the below questions
023 * <p>
024 * Should this class eventually implement {@link org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.RxBlockchainService}
025 * or {@link org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.RxBlockchainBinaryService}?
026 * <p>
027 * Should this class be renamed to {@code RxBitcoinJsonRpcClient} and the {@code RxBitcoinClient} interface be moved
028 * to {@code cj-btx-rx?}
029 */
030public class RxBitcoinClient extends BitcoinExtendedClient implements RxJsonChainTipClient {
031    ChainTipService chainTipService;
032
033    public RxBitcoinClient(Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
034        this(network, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword, true);
035    }
036
037    public RxBitcoinClient(Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword, boolean useZmq) {
038        this((SSLSocketFactory) SSLSocketFactory.getDefault(), network, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword, useZmq);
039    }
040
041    public RxBitcoinClient(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory, Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword, boolean useZmq) {
042        super(sslSocketFactory, network, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
043        // TODO: Determine if ZMQ is available by querying the server
044        // TODO: Determine whether server is up or down -- add a session re-establishment service
045        if (useZmq) {
046            chainTipService = new RxBitcoinZmqService(this);
047        } else {
048            chainTipService = new PollingChainTipServiceImpl(this);
049        }
050    }
051
052    @Override
053    public Flowable<ChainTip> chainTipPublisher() {
054        return Flowable.fromPublisher(chainTipService.chainTipPublisher());
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * Convert best {@link Block} to active {@link ChainTip}. If BIP34 is activated this
059     * is purely computational, otherwise I/O is required to fetch the {@code ChainTip}
060     *
061     * @param block Input best block
062     * @return active ChainTip assuming this block is the "best block"
063     */
064    public Single<ChainTip> activeChainTipFromBestBlock(Block block) {
065        int height = BlockUtil.blockHeightFromCoinbase(block);
066        if (height != -1) {
067            return Single.just(ChainTip.ofActive(height, block.getHash()));
068        } else {
069            return getActiveChainTipViaRpc();
070        }
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * Get the latest (aka "best") {@link Block} via JSON-RPC.
075     * <p>
076     * Generally, you should use the {@link org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.RxBlockchainService} or
077     * {@link org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.RxBlockchainBinaryService} interface if you
078     * are looking for a reactive interface to blocks, because those interfaces will
079     * be more efficient. This method <b>always</b> composes two unique RPC calls to the server.
080     *
081     * @return A "hot" {@code Single} that will fetch the "best" block via JSON-RPC
082     */
083    public Single<Block> getBestBlockViaRpc() {
084        return getActiveChainTipViaRpc().flatMap(tip -> getBlockSingle(tip.getHash()));
085    }
086
087    private Single<ChainTip> getActiveChainTipViaRpc() {
088        return call(this::getChainTips)
089                .map(ChainTip::findActiveChainTipOrElseThrow);
090    }
091
092    private Single<Block> getBlockSingle(Sha256Hash blockHash) {
093        return call(() -> getBlock(blockHash));
094    }
095}
